Articles.Content:
Would anybody like to see a simple one part International Space Station, where you can simulate progress, soyuz, dragon dockings etc. ?

Made a quick one here

![bnL5BOY.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/bnL5BOY.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-23T13:05:59Z" title="07/23/2015 01:05  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 23, 2015</time> by xxhansonmaxx**

> 
> Would anybody like to see a simple one part International Space Station, where you can simulate progress, soyuz, dragon dockings etc. ?
> Made a quick one here
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/bnL5BOY.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/bnL5BOY.jpg)

I'm guessing you have to use hyperedit to get that thing to orbit, right?

> 
> I'm guessing you have to use hyperedit to get that thing to orbit, right?

or u can try launching the whole thing with a rocket XD
low part station would be nice but one part is insane
It's an OK idea, although, It does take out the fun since it's just one part, and how in the heck are ya gonna launch it?

> 
> It's an OK idea, although, It does take out the fun since it's just one part, and how in the heck are ya gonna launch it?

Scientific discoveries from recent manned expeditions to Jool made construction (and flying) of one-piece space stations. New material has an ability to include any module: from solar panels to landing gears. Test flights reveal that new ISS performs usually well while going two kilometres per second at 21,000 metres, unlike old capsules. Kerbalkind shall, for this, be eternally grateful to the inventor, dr. Bonkers Kerman.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-25T16:40:25Z" title="07/25/2015 04:40  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 25, 2015</time> by viktor19**
